title: Strictly's Tess wows in hot pink jumpsuit while Claudia dons all-black outfit on results show
text:

Strictly Come Dancing has always loved a bit of glitz and glam, and presenters Tess and Claudia are no exception.

Tonight the presenting duo both stepped onto the ballroom in classy fashion ensembles, ahead of delivering the shocking results of week four's dance-off.

Claudia Winkleman , 47, sticked to her trademark all-black fashion and opted for a classic look with tailored, ankle-skimming trousers and a long-sleeved blouse with monochrome tie-up detailing.

The brunette beaut accessorised with matching stiletto heels and oversized hoop earrings; she also wore her tousled locks in her standard bouncy blow-dried waves.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: Instagram)

The mum-of-three added glamour to her Strictly Results show look with dark eyeshadow, thick mascara and added a slick of nude gloss to her lips.

While Tess Daly , 50, stunned in a vibrant wide-legged jumpsuit with dramatic floaty sleeves and ruched detailing.

The blonde presenting star glowed as she accentuated her natural beauty with a rose-tinted make-up look and wore her bright blonde tresses in her famous swept over style.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

Despite presenting as a united front, both presenters have their own personal stylists to ensure their looks suit their individual personalities.

The co-hosts' stunning fashion choices tonight come after fans were baffled by their outfits on Saturday night's live show.

Viewers accused Tess of being too 'seasonal' as she debuted a jaw-dropping stripy gown embellished with sequins and sparkles, while critics slammed Claudia for once again wearing an all-black ensemble.

One social media user shared: "Can someone tell Claudia it's not Halloween quite yet."

While another wrote: "I see The bride of Dracula Winkleman's in her black coffin gown again!"

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

Last night's glittering show was a big one as competition heated up for the remaining 13 couples.

Karim Zeroual and Amy Dowden soared to the top of the leaderboard after their passionate Tango performance.

Two points behind were Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse, who scored 36 for their saucy Rumba routine.

At the other end of the score table were Alex Scott and Neil Jones, who finished last on the leaderboard with 23.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: BBC)

Tonight's results show will reveal the next celebrity to be booted off the show and join fellow voted off stars Anneka Rice and James Cracknell.

Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton received the lowest score last week. They were voted off after scoring a total of 11 points for their Charleston to Woo Hoo from Kill Bill.

James Cracknell was the first celebrity to be voted off the popular BBC dance competition after struggling to impress on the dancefloor with his professional partner Luba Mushtuk .

*Strictly Come Dancing returns next Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One
description: The Strictly Come Dancing hosts wore classy outfits to present week four's shocking results show on Sunday night
